description: Project rules for AI assistants working with the Semantic System project
core_principles: Always maintain a single source of truth for project state and progress
Document all decisions, design choices, and implementation details
Test thoroughly after each implementation step
Keep the documentation organized and cross-referenced
Follow the phased approach outlined in the master checklist

steps: Read the master checklist at /docs/planning/SEMANTIC_SYSTEM_MASTER_CHECKLIST.md first
Review the documentation index at /docs/README.md to understand the project structure
Check the strategy and vision documents to understand the project goals
Identify current phase and next steps from the master checklist
Start with the first unchecked item in the current phase

documentation_rules.continuous_documentation: If anything new, unclear, or not yet documented arises during development, it must be noted and added to the documentation in the correct place according to the docs directory structure. This ensures ongoing documentation completeness and accuracy.

directory_structure./docs/planning/: Project status, checklists, strategy, vision, improvements, and dev plans
directory_structure./docs/design-docs/: All system and component design docs

documentation_standards: Add onboarding or high-level intros to /docs/onboarding/
For component-specific docs, create a subdirectory (e.g., /docs/graphiti/)
Always update /docs/README.md when adding new documentation
Cross-link relevant docs for context and onboarding
documentation_rules.file_naming: Use UPPERCASE for major system components, lowercase for specific features

before_starting: Review master checklist and identify current phase and next steps
Check the specific acceptance criteria for your task
Review any existing design docs related to your task
Create or update design docs if necessary
during_implementation: Follow the subtasks in order of dependency
Write or update tests for all features
after_each_step: Run appropriate tests (unit, integration, or end-to-end)
Fix any failing tests before proceeding
Update the master checklist with progress
Document any issues or blockers in PROJECT_STATUS.md

testing_requirements.unit_tests: Required for all new components and functions
testing_requirements.integration_tests: Required for API endpoints and service interactions

phase_tracking.how_to_identify_current_phase: Look for the first phase in the master checklist with unchecked items
phase_tracking.how_to_identify_next_task: Find the first unchecked item in the current phase
phase_tracking.update_frequency: After completing any task or subtask
phase_tracking.progress_tracking: Use checkboxes in the master checklist ([x] for done, [ ] for not done)

status_tracking.update_master_checklist: After completing any step or subtask
status_tracking.record_decisions: Document all significant decisions and their rationales
status_tracking.track_progress: Use checkboxes in the master checklist

handover_process.update_documentation: Ensure all documentation is current before handover
handover_process.summarize_progress: Add a status update to PROJECT_STATUS.md
handover_process.note_next_steps: Clearly indicate what should be done next
handover_process.reference_checklist: Always refer to the master checklist for context
